Options: When there are no vertices left to visit
When a vertex is discovered that has already been visited

Questions.Text:
In Union-Find Cycle Detection,
 how is a cycle detected?
Options: When two vertices belong to different unions

When there is a higher number of 
 negative vertices than positive ones
When a new union if found
When two vertices already belong to the same union

Questions.Text:

One area for data, and one area
 with a pointer to the next node in the list

Questions.Text:
An operating system adopts the priority scheduling 
 algorithm for scheduling processes. Five processes P1-P4 
(note: four provided in list) arrive at the same time with running 
 times 10, 32, 6, and 22ms and priorities 3, 4, 2, and 1.
 What is the mean total waiting time?
What is the primary challenge for quantum computing today?
Options: Lack of enough qubits to perform complex tasks
Difficulty in interfacing with classical systems

Questions.Text:
What is the primary benefit of CPU 
 pipelining in computer architecture?
Options: It increases the clock speed of the CPU.
It minimises the power consumption of the CPU.
It allows multiple instructions to be processed simultaneously in different stages.
It reduces the size of the CPU

Questions.Text:
Which of the following best describes 
 a fundamental characteristic of quantum computing?
Options: Quantum computers use classical bits (1s and 0s) to process information.
Quantum computers rely on quantum bits (qubits) that can exist in multiple states simultaneously.
Quantum computers are slower than traditional computers.
Quantum computers are limited to solving only mathematical problems.

Questions.Text:
ABC company applies a three-generation backup policy.
 The ABC company’s system automatically performs
 full back up on the 10th, 17th, and 25th of each month.
 If the latest back up was performed on 17th September, 
 what is the date that the oldest information was backed up?

the computer that terminates the data
the computer that originates the data
